channel.title: BBC News - Latin America & Caribbean
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Brazil: Why are so many pregnant women dying from Covid?
item.description: One in five women that died from coronavirus in Brazil did not have access to an intensive care unit.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Flora Duffy claims historic first gold for Bermuda
item.description: With a population of just 63,000, Bermuda became the least populous nation or territory to win an Olympic gold medal at a summer Games when Flora Duffy won the triathlon in Tokyo.

item.title: Neymar: Paris St-Germain forward and Barcelona settle legal dispute
item.description: Barcelona reach an out-of-court agreement in "amicable fashion" with former forward Neymar to end a legal dispute between the club and player.

item.title: Covid: Delta variant spreads globally as cases soar
item.description: With low global vaccination rates, the variant's spread is threatening to overwhelm health systems.

item.title: Excitement over wooden shipwreck found in Antigua's seabed
item.description: Historians believe the wreck found in Antigua to be the 1762 Beaumont, a French merchant ship.

item.title: The black immigrant who challenged US segregation - nearly 190 years ago
item.description: A black Brazilian immigrant was the first person in US history to challenge segregation in a courtroom

item.title: Carapaz wins Ecuador's second ever Olympic gold
item.description: Geraint Thomas' medal hopes are dashed during fall in the men's road race as Ecuador's Richard Carapaz wins gold.

item.title: Jovenel Moïse: Unrest mars funeral of assassinated Haitian leader
item.description: Gunshots and tear gas punctuate the funeral of former Haitian President Jovenel Moïse.

item.title: Trading sex for cosmetic surgery in Mexico's narco capital
item.description: The influence of narcos has caused many women to undergo cosmetic surgery in Mexico's Sinaloa state.

item.title: Covid: The Mexican villages refusing to vaccinate
item.description: Residents in remote Mexican towns are being influenced by lies and rumours swirling around on WhatsApp.

item.title: Latin American Foto Festival: Strength and resistance
item.description: Caribbean and Latin American photography features in the fourth Annual Latin American Foto Festival.

item.title: Covid-19: Second doses run dry in Brazil's scramble to vaccinate
item.description: Many are struggling to source their second dose of the Covid-19 jab in one of the worst-hit countries.

item.title: Climate change: Amazon regions emit more carbon than they absorb
item.description: Rising heat and deforestation cause eastern parts of the Amazon to become carbon sources, not sinks.

item.title: Colombia bets on privately funded Covid vaccinations
item.description: The private-sector scheme allows companies to vaccinate their Colombian staff, regardless of need.

item.title: Dust devil almost takes out football players at match in Bolivia
item.description: The whirlwind, often mistaken for a tornado, came as a shock but appeared to cause no damage in Bolivia.

item.title: Floridians rally in support of Cuban protesters
item.description: Across Florida, Cuban-Americans have been rallying to show their support for protests in Cuba.

item.title: Debbie Harry on Blondie's 'monumental' Cuba trip and her reunion demands
item.description: The star recalls two historic concerts in Havana, and reveals her demand before reforming Blondie.

item.title: Cuba: Rare protests see thousands on streets
item.description: Protesters say they are angry about the government’s handling of both coronavirus and the economy.

item.title: Colombian anti-government protesters topple Columbus statue
item.description: Anti-government protesters in Colombia have toppled a statue of Christopher Columbus in the coastal city of Barranquilla.

item.title: Sea lion opens gate to crash fisherman's interview about a 'plague of sea lions'
item.description: A sea lion was caught on camera crashing an interview with a fisherman about a "plague of sea lions".

item.title: US migrant camp 'kids feel like they're in prison'
item.description: More than 2,000 migrant children are being detained in an overcrowded camp in Texas ridden with disease.

item.title: Windrush Day 2021: 'I wanted to put my culture out there'
item.description: Choreographer Rosy May produces performance on the evolution of Caribbean dance.
